name: Youth Culture, Racialization and Crime in the Global Context
description: An advanced seminar exploring youth culture and its possible connection to criminality from an international perspective.
department: Centre for Criminology and Sociolegal Studies
prerequisites: 2 CRI 300 half-credit lecture/seminar courses (0.5 may be substituted by a 300+ level HIS/PHL/PSY/SOC course)
